posts.author: HomebrewHero
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Creative lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Creative that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Creative and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Creative?

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Magic functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of Magic to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

Our table uses a house rule for Magic where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
My DM interprets Creative differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Creative functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for Creative, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Creative. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Creative that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve Magic? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.
